*div1 type="summary"* *p*Ayuntamiento of Bexar to Austin, October 31, 1833. Refusing to lead in organizing State government of Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*The honorable *person_mentioned*ayuntamiento */person_mentioned*of this town, being advised of the official letter which you directed to it, dated the *date_mentioned n="09-02-1833">2d of the month just passed*/date_mentioned*, has seen with the greatest regret and surprise the exciting plea which you make to them that not a moment be lost in directing a communication to the rest of the *person_mentioned*department */person_mentioned*and treating with them in order that *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*may separate from *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned* and establish a *person_mentioned*local government*/person_mentioned* for itself, even though the *person_mentioned*general government*/person_mentioned* refuses its consent. It is certainly very regretable that you should breathe sentiments so contrary and opposed to those of every good *person_mentioned*Mexican*/person_mentioned*, whose constitution and laws prohibit in a positive manner this class of proceedings, as you very well know, and when the ephemeral support which it is believed to have in the general law of the *date_mentioned n="05-07-1824">7th of May, 1824*/date_mentioned*, is entirely apparent to the most moderate political capacity of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. Thus it is that this corporation neither can nor ought, nor even wishes, to follow your suggestion, and it begs that you cease writing to it in regard to this matter, because you know very well what these communications render one liable to, considering the laws and orders of the state which must be obeyed, and which up to the present time there is no reason to violate in so brusque a manner as you propose—¦ especially as there is wanting any reasonable ground which could be sustained, once the enterprise were begun.*/p*
*p*Much has already been said in what has been written concerning the separation of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned*, and much more that you heard here personally, showing you clearly that we have none of the elemente, physically and morally, for sustaining a *person_mentioned*local government*/person_mentioned*. It is beyond all doubt, therefore, that this project neither can nor ought to be entertained by any *person_mentioned*citizen of *location_mentioned*Coahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* who recognizes the interests of his *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and of himself.*/p*
*p*In conclusion, this corporation entreats you, inasmuch as the state of revolution in which the *location_mentioned*colonies of this department*/location_mentioned*, especially that of which you are *person_mentioned*empresario*/person_mentioned*, have been placed since *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1832">last year*/date_mentioned* seems about to be terminated by the measures of leniency and prudence which the *person_mentioned*supreme government of the state*/person_mentioned* has lately decreed, that you bethink yourself and do not provoke a new motive for disturbance, which, as you will see if you clearly examine it, must be more injurious to the *person_mentioned*colonists */person_mentioned*than to any one else, and particularly to yourself. We desire the progress of this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and with it our own and that of the *location_mentioned*colonists */location_mentioned*established in it, our *person_mentioned*co-laborers*/person_mentioned* for the attainment of the desired end. But we desire that this be attained by legal and peaceful measures which shall not jeopardize the tranquillity of the *person_mentioned*department*/person_mentioned*, and that we may assure to ourselves and to our children forever the possession of the properties that we acquire in it; and there is no doubt that the measure which you propose is exceedingly rash.*/p*
*p*God and Liberty.*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Bejar*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="10-31-1833">Oct. 31, 1833*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
